div1.p: Borden thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for the memento of Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from William C. Borden to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 29, 1928

opener.dateline:
2306 TRACY PLACE, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C. Tuesday evening
May 29. 1928

div1.p:
Mrs Borden and I
have just returned from Arlington
where we placed roses on Dr
Reed's resting place. I thought
you might like to know
of something rather unusual
There. Close to his headstone
were six flags arranged about
it while nowhere else in
Arlington was there more than
one at each stone.

Some one in placing the
flags must have known and
so expressed a significant
evidence of the merited high
distinction.

Please accept my grateful
thank for the paper knife
which I shall alwas treasure
and transmit to my
Medical line of descendants.

Mrs Borden and I have
recently returned from a trip
down the Shanandoah Valley
and saw the place marked where
Dr Reed passed his boyhood.
His high place is being more
and more appreciated and noted.

Mrs Borden joins me in all
best remembrances
